TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TextFormatFlags extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the display and layout information for text strings.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TextFormatFlags enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer> when drawing and measuring text. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer> does not support adding tab stops to drawn text, although you can expand existing tab stops using the ExpandTabs flag.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the TextFormatFlags enumeration. To run this example, paste the following code into a Windows Form. Call `RenderText6` from the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event handler, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TextRendererExamples#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.t_69_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TextRendererExamples#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.t_69_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags Bottom = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Aligns the text on the bottom of the bounding rectangle. Applied only when the text is a single line.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Applies the default formatting, which is left-aligned.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags EndEllipsis = int32(32768)

Docs.summary: Removes the end of trimmed lines, and replaces them with an ellipsis.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags ExpandTabs = int32(64)

Docs.summary: Expands tab characters. The default number of characters per tab is eight. The WordEllipsis, PathEllipsis, and EndEllipsis values cannot be used with ExpandTabs.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags ExternalLeading = int32(512)

Docs.summary: Includes the font external leading in line height. Typically, external leading is not included in the height of a line of text.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags GlyphOverhangPadding = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Adds padding to the bounding rectangle to accommodate overhanging glyphs.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags HidePrefix = int32(1048576)

Docs.summary: Applies to Windows 2000 and Windows XP only:

remarks.format:
## Remarks Ignores the ampersand (&) prefix character in the text. The letter that follows will not be underlined, but other mnemonic-prefix characters are still processed. For example, an input string of "A&bc&&d" with HidePrefix applied would result in output of "Abc&d".
Compare with NoPrefix and PrefixOnly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags HorizontalCenter = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Centers the text horizontally within the bounding rectangle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags Internal = int32(4096)

Docs.summary: Uses the system font to calculate text metrics.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags Left = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Aligns the text on the left side of the clipping area.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags LeftAndRightPadding = int32(536870912)

Docs.summary: Adds padding to both sides of the bounding rectangle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags ModifyString = int32(65536)

Docs.summary: Has no effect on the drawn text.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags NoClipping = int32(256)

Docs.summary: Allows the overhanging parts of glyphs and unwrapped text reaching outside the formatting rectangle to show.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags NoFullWidthCharacterBreak = int32(524288)

Docs.summary: Applies to Windows 98, Windows Me, Windows 2000, or Windows XP only:

remarks.format: ## Remarks Prevents a line break at a double-wide character string, so that the line-breaking rule is equivalent to single-wide character strings. For example, NoFullWidthCharacterBreak increases the readability of icon labels in Korean windows. This value has no effect unless WordBreak is also specified.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags NoPadding = int32(268435456)

Docs.summary: Does not add padding to the bounding rectangle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags NoPrefix = int32(2048)

Docs.summary: Turns off processing of prefix characters. Typically, the ampersand (&) mnemonic-prefix character is interpreted as a directive to underscore the character that follows, and the double-ampersand (&&) mnemonic-prefix characters as a directive to print a single ampersand. By specifying NoPrefix, this processing is turned off. For example, an input string of "A&bc&&d" with NoPrefix applied would result in output of "A&bc&&d".

remarks.format: ## Remarks Compare with HidePrefix and PrefixOnly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags PathEllipsis = int32(16384)

Docs.summary: Removes the center of trimmed lines and replaces it with an ellipsis.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags PrefixOnly = int32(2097152)

Docs.summary: Applies to Windows 2000 or Windows XP only:

remarks.format:
## Remarks Draws only an underline at the position of the character following the ampersand (&) prefix character. Does not draw any other characters in the string. For example, an input string of "A&bc&&d" would result in output of " _ ".
Compare with HidePrefix and NoPrefix.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags PreserveGraphicsClipping = int32(16777216)

Docs.summary: Preserves the clipping specified by a object. Applies only to methods receiving an that is a .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags PreserveGraphicsTranslateTransform = int32(33554432)

Docs.summary: Preserves the transformation specified by a . Applies only to methods receiving an that is a .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags Right = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Aligns the text on the right side of the clipping area.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags RightToLeft = int32(131072)

Docs.summary: Displays the text from right to left.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags SingleLine = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Displays the text in a single line.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags TextBoxControl = int32(8192)

Docs.summary: Specifies the text should be formatted for display on a control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags Top = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Aligns the text on the top of the bounding rectangle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags VerticalCenter = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Centers the text vertically, within the bounding rectangle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags WordBreak = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Breaks the text at the end of a word.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags WordEllipsis = int32(262144)

Docs.summary: Trims the line to the nearest word and an ellipsis is placed at the end of a trimmed line.
